title: How to Make a Shooting Star Glass Decoration from a Plastic Straw

steps.headline: Select the items needed as listed below.
steps.description: Choose straw colors that reflect the occasion.

steps.headline: Prepare the plastic straw.
steps.description: Select a straw length of about 10cm (4"). You might need to cut it to size. Press along the length of the straw to fold in place a single line, as shown in the image.

steps.headline: Make a series of cuts as explained in this step.
steps.description:
First, check this diagram and use it as a reference for each cut. Cut the middle, thick piece first. Use the diagram and image to guide your cutting. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1d/Sc2_419.JPG/459px-Sc2_419.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1d/Sc2_419.JPG/759px-Sc2_419.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":344,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":568.9560439560439,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Cut the lower blue line from the diagram, as shown in the image. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/15/Sc3_3.JPG/460px-Sc3_3.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/15/Sc3_3.JPG/760px-Sc3_3.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Finish up by cutting the jagged edges at one end. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3a/Sc5_152.JPG/460px-Sc5_152.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3a/Sc5_152.JPG/760px-Sc5_152.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":346,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":571.0439560439561,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"}

steps.headline: Fold the jagged end cuts out like petals opening from a flower.
Cut away a triangle from each "petal", so that the resulting petals are triangular in shape.
steps.description:
Again, use the images for guidance. This should be how the "petals" end up appearing:{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/50/Sc8_17.JPG/459px-Sc8_17.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/50/Sc8_17.JPG/759px-Sc8_17.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":344,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":568.9560439560439,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"}

steps.headline: Bend the shooting tail end of the star so that it curls into place.
steps.description:
Once curled, this is how the curl will appear:{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f1/Sc10_913.JPG/460px-Sc10_913.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f1/Sc10_913.JPG/760px-Sc10_913.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"}

steps.headline: Cut the grip portion of the straw.
steps.description: In order for the star straw to be able to sit on the glass rim, there needs to be a small slit to slide the straw onto the glass. Make a small snip to create this grip at the end of the straw.

steps.headline: Fill the hole at the star end of the straw.
steps.description:
Using the small pearl bead or similar bead, fit into place in the center of the hole in the straw, to form the star's center. It should fit snugly, as shown in this image. If it's loose at all, you might need to use non-toxic glue to keep it in place, to prevent it from dropping into the drink. Alternatively, use a small pompom that will squeeze easily into shape in the hole. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c7/Sc13_875.JPG/460px-Sc13_875.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c7/Sc13_875.JPG/760px-Sc13_875.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} If you'd like a lively star, consider decorating it with a marker to include a smile. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/15/Sc19_645.JPG/459px-Sc19_645.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/15/Sc19_645.JPG/759px-Sc19_645.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":344,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":568.9560439560439,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"}

steps.headline: Check that you're happy with it and make any adjustments needed.
Attach the shooting star decoration to the rim of the glass.
steps.description: Fill with your drink and enjoy!

text:
Select the items needed as listed below. Choose straw colors that reflect the occasion. Prepare the plastic straw. Select a straw length of about 10cm (4"). You might need to cut it to size. Press along the length of the straw to fold in place a single line, as shown in the image. Make a series of cuts as explained in this step. First, check this diagram and use it as a reference for each cut. Cut the middle, thick piece first. Use the diagram and image to guide your cutting. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1d/Sc2_419.JPG/459px-Sc2_419.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1d/Sc2_419.JPG/759px-Sc2_419.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":344,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":568.9560439560439,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Cut the lower blue line from the diagram, as shown in the image. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/15/Sc3_3.JPG/460px-Sc3_3.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/15/Sc3_3.JPG/760px-Sc3_3.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Finish up by cutting the jagged edges at one end. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3a/Sc5_152.JPG/460px-Sc5_152.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3a/Sc5_152.JPG/760px-Sc5_152.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":346,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":571.0439560439561,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Fold the jagged end cuts out like petals opening from a flower. See the image for guidance. Cut away a triangle from each "petal", so that the resulting petals are triangular in shape. Again, use the images for guidance. This should be how the "petals" end up appearing:{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/50/Sc8_17.JPG/459px-Sc8_17.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/50/Sc8_17.JPG/759px-Sc8_17.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":344,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":568.9560439560439,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Bend the shooting tail end of the star so that it curls into place. Once curled, this is how the curl will appear:{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f1/Sc10_913.JPG/460px-Sc10_913.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f1/Sc10_913.JPG/760px-Sc10_913.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Cut the grip portion of the straw. In order for the star straw to be able to sit on the glass rim, there needs to be a small slit to slide the straw onto the glass. Make a small snip to create this grip at the end of the straw. Fill the hole at the star end of the straw. Using the small pearl bead or similar bead, fit into place in the center of the hole in the straw, to form the star's center. It should fit snugly, as shown in this image. If it's loose at all, you might need to use non-toxic glue to keep it in place, to prevent it from dropping into the drink. Alternatively, use a small pompom that will squeeze easily into shape in the hole. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c7/Sc13_875.JPG/460px-Sc13_875.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c7/Sc13_875.JPG/760px-Sc13_875.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} If you'd like a lively star, consider decorating it with a marker to include a smile. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/15/Sc19_645.JPG/459px-Sc19_645.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/15/Sc19_645.JPG/759px-Sc19_645.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":344,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":568.9560439560439,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Check that you're happy with it and make any adjustments needed. It's now completed. Attach the shooting star decoration to the rim of the glass. Fill with your drink and enjoy!
